title: LLM-Friendly API Design

problem.en: APIs designed solely for human consumption might be ambiguous or overly complex for an LLM to use correctly without extensive fine-tuning or elaborate prompting.
problem.ko: 인간 소비만을 위해 설계된 API는 광범위한 미세조정이나 정교한 프롬프팅 없이는 LLM이 올바르게 사용하기에 모호하거나 지나치게 복잡할 수 있습니다.

solution.en: Design APIs with LLM consumption in mind: explicit versioning visible to model, self-descriptive function names, simplified interaction patterns, clear error messaging, reduced indirection levels.
solution.ko: LLM 소비를 염두에 둔 API 설계: 모델에 보이는 명시적 버전 관리, 자기 설명적 함수 이름, 단순화된 상호작용 패턴, 명확한 오류 메시지, 감소된 간접 수준.

ascii_diagram:
HUMAN-CENTRIC API:
├── Complex nested calls
├── Implicit versioning
├── Ambiguous error codes
└── Many indirection levels

LLM-FRIENDLY API:
├── Flat, direct calls
├── Visible version: v2.1.0
├── Actionable error messages
└── 2 levels of indirection max
mermaid_diagram:
flowchart TD
    A[API Design] --> B{Consumer Focus}
    B -->|Human-Centric| C[Implicit Versions]
    C --> D[Nested Calls]
    D --> E[LLM Struggles]
    B -->|LLM-Friendly| F[Explicit Versions]
    F --> G[Self-Descriptive Names]
    G --> H[Clear Errors]
    H --> I[Reduced Indirection]
    I --> J[LLM Success]
code_example:
# Human-centric (problematic for LLM)
result = client.v2.users.get_by_id(id).profile.settings
# Ambiguous: what version? many indirections

# LLM-friendly design
result = get_user_settings(
    user_id=123,
    api_version='v2.1.0'  # Explicit, visible
)
# Error: {'code': 'USER_NOT_FOUND', 
#         'action': 'Verify user_id exists before calling'}
